intro: Scleranthus havranus, commonly known as the Balkan sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and the flowers are pink or purple in color. Scleranthus havranus is adapted to thrive in arid conditions and is considered a resilient species in its native range.
